title: Ticket #293: Boot script for Mac OS X
description:
We should distribute sample files for launching Condor at boot time under Mac OS X using the launchd service. This the the preferred why to start and stop daemons on Mac OS 10.4 and above. The files should take advantage of launchd features when appropriate, like automatic relaunching of condor_master if it doesn't exit cleanly.

Details on handling daemons in Mac OS X can be found at http://developer.apple.com/technotes/tn2005/tn2083.html
remarks:
2009-Aug-31 16:54:15 by cstruble:
Using launchd with Condor is problematic with condor_master 's current behavior. According to the launchd.plist manual page: 

     A daemon or agent launched by launchd MUST NOT do the following in the
     process directly launched by launchd:

           o   Call daemon(3).
           o   Do the moral equivalent of daemon(3) by calling fork(2) and
               have the parent process exit(3) or _exit(2).

     A daemon or agent launched by launchd SHOULD NOT do the following as a
     part of their startup initialization:

           o   Setup the user ID or group ID.
           o   Setup the working directory.
           o   chroot(2)
           o   setsid(2)
           o   Close "stray" file descriptors.
           o   Change stdio(3) to /dev/null.
           o   Setup resource limits with setrusage(2).
           o   Setup priority with setpriority(2).
           o   Ignore the SIGTERM signal.

When placing the relatively simple launchd description in /Library/LaunchDaemons/condor.plist 

	<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
	<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN"
		"http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
	<plist version="1.0">
	<dict>
		<key>Label</key>
		<string>condor</string>
		<key>ProgramArguments</key>
		<array>
			<string>/usr/local/condor/sbin/condor_master</string>
		</array>
		<key>RunAtLoad</key>
		<true/>
                <key>KeepAlive</key>
                <true/>
	</dict>
	</plist>

The condor_master is repeatedly terminated with SIGTERM shortly after spawning off other daemons.

2009-Sep-18 10:40:12 by cstruble:
After reading the Condor documentation a bit more, changing condor_master to run in foreground mode (adding -f) seems to do the trick initially. A successful /Library/LaunchDaemons/condor.plist file on OS X 10.5 is 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN"
        "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
    <plist version="1.0">
    <dict>
        <key>EnvironmentVariables</key>
        <dict>
            <key>CONDOR_CONFIG</key>
            <string>/usr/local/condor/etc/condor_config</string>
        </dict>
        <key>Label</key>
        <string>condor</string>
        <key>ProgramArguments</key>
        <array>
            <string>/usr/local/condor/sbin/condor_master</string>
            <string>-f</string>
        </array>
        <key>RunAtLoad</key>
        <true/>
        <key>KeepAlive</key>
        <true/>
    </dict>
    </plist>

Note that the CONDOR_CONFIG environment variable needs to be set unless condor_config is in the condor user's home directory.
